channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Wordle 295 4/6 â¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œ â¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œ ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ¨â¬œâ¬œâ¬œ ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©
The Hummer EV is an electric truck for people who think EVs are stupid. https://t.co/rzCyt9c6XA
Elon Musk could dictate the future of Twitter. https://t.co/dPWrqKgYur
This is what it's like having a young team to root for, full of love. Okay so they didn't make the post-season. I'm still proud to be a Knicks fan. https://t.co/3SUGcb5y8G
This is what it looks like when a Home Depot burns to the ground. https://t.co/1H0uFV1SVk
I guess this is Sgt Pepper 3.0. https://t.co/Pcze5rC96j
Incredible ski maps. https://t.co/sRI4zKHfff
@jayrosen_nyu We knew this would happen, right? Nature abhors a vacuum.

Bookmarks in Drummer are super powerful. They're used to mark place in outlines that you want to come back to. The bookmarks still work if you reorg the outline. If you're into #toolsforthought you should read this. https://t.co/FJQbcHuG3h

@gruber -- I've been doing some restoration on old DaveNet stuff from the 90s. Thought you'd get a kick out of this -- I was doing a markdownish sort of thing with the emails. Note the #syntax for attributes. Might be useful these days. cc @logseq https://t.co/iVrpfPDqHZ
What is the most famous radio station in the US? https://t.co/qvF6chkyNK
@galaxybloom_ Yes, I thought of that. Unfortunately for the people who stole it, if it was stolen, they got access to a phone I never used as a phone. ;-)

I was looking for a project I was doing in the early 00s and tripped across an OPML archive for all the DaveNet essays. I suspected something like that existed. Now I will add it to the official archive on GitHub and add it to the https://t.co/gRtwl1wvk7 index.
Unfortunately each of the OPML files has the same title, so we've lost the titles of the pieces. They could be reconstructed from the web archive, but that would be very tedious. I'm going to try to figure out how this collection was created.
I found the real archive, and now will do the cleaning and prep work to get it into Daytona and into the GitHub repo archiving all my blog work.
Also, the scripts and mail list for the email distribution is part of this archive. This is a real relic! ;-)
https://t.co/dpOdXxGQcf
@frankm It made it hard to do anything innovative in software on the Mac in the years after it was introduced. People thought they could do everything in HC, and Apple encouraged it.
@frankm https://t.co/dfe9V2OP1H

If only the Dems had a permanent ad agency response team that could get a meme-like ad on the web in hours or minutes after a door is opened like this. Instead they have lame vague quotes months later. https://t.co/8vpqbNXX6Z

I had a small package delivered today via Fedex containing a SIM that I was going to use in my phone. But the package was opened, and there was nothing inside. This seems to be happening a lot these days. Hackers get jobs at Fedex or UPS and grab stuff as it's in transit.
And FedEx apologizes for any inconvenience. https://t.co/B2jPY8YUxH
@HarrisonFjord9 He's bluffing.

A fantasy -- The US Air Force bombs the fukc out of the Russian army in Ukraine, in an afternoon. Leaves their corpses in streets to rot like they did to the Ukranians. If Putin complains Biden says, if you don't want to lose your army, keep it out of other people's countries.
@jeremyzilar wow you're on today jz

@jeffjarvis @jamesrbuk @kylepope @kathyenglish Cut off his cash flow. An executive order that requires cable operators to let customers specify no money for Murdoch. Defund Fox Dudes.
